Project Name: Coastal Protection Measures on sea erosion for Chinnakalapet, Periyakalapet, Pillaichavady, Pillaichavady North, Ganapathychettikulam in Puducherry
Alternative Site Examined: Not applicable as the project or activity is site specific
Project Description: The Kalapet Coastal Protection Project involves the implementation of a strategically designed groyne field system along a 3.75 km stretch of shoreline between latitudes 12.010° to 12.042° North and longitudes 79.859° to 79.874° East, encompassing the villages of Pillaichavady, Pillaichavady (North), Chinna Kalapet, Periya Kalapet, and Ganapathchettikulam in Puducherry. Following extensive site assessment and consultation with stakeholders, the National Centre for Coastal Research (NCCR) has designed a comprehensive system comprising 9 longitudinal groynes (80m length) and 15 transitional groynes (45-60m length) to stabilize the eroding coastline. Construction specifications include the use of 3-tonne tetrapods for head sections in deeper waters and various grades of stone armor (500-2,000 kg) for trunk sections, with proper under-layers and core materials. This engineered solution aims to protect the immediate coastline while minimizing impacts on adjacent areas.
